revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Grandstream |model=GXV3175 |revision=v2 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date= |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=VoIP phone |fcc_id=YZZGXV3175-T |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Texas Instruments |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand=Toshiba |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num=2 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0,SD Card |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Proware PW-MN427 |wi1_module_if=USB (non-standard connector) |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT3070 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Micrel |sw_model=KSZ8842-16 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |flags=camera,HDMI in |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.60 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} The device clearly uses a Texas Instruments SoC, but it is not easily discernible from the FCC internal photos. It may be a [http://www.ti.com/product/dm3730 DM3730] (DaVinci Video Processor). "Rev: 1.0" and "2052500285" is silkscreened on the wireless module. A label with a MAC address on the device indicates the OUI is 6C:FD:B9. :This is clearly a TP-LINK module, rebranded by Proware ([http://www.worldbid.com/kingtech TP-LINK was once a Shenzhen Proware Electronics brand] ([http://web.archive.org/web/20020119230731/http://tp-link.com.cn/ old TP-LINK site on archive.org]), but now the TP-LINK brand seems to have become the primary designation for the company). :Specifically, the model is a [[Proware PW-MN427]]. A later model appears to use a '''PESI''' module. (FCC ID: YZZGXV3175-P) The board has silkscreened text near the USB connectors (probably) indicating the maximum provided per connector. The upper connector is marked as 300mA. The lower connector (closest to the SD Card slot) is marked as 700mA. '''From the manual..'''
GXV3175 OVERVIEW The GXV3175 is an ideal desktop IP multimedia phone highlighting 7‚Äù touch screen color LCD, tilt capable 1.3M CMOS camera, integrated Wifi, comprehensive auxiliary ports, feature-rich web applications with novel streamline design and modeling. It supports a high quality selection of audio codecs and is compatible with the H.264/H.263/H.263+ video codec. The advanced telephony and video features, interoperability with third party SIP products and ease of use make it an innovative and unique IP multimedia device for both enterprise and consumer users. Per the manual in the FCC docs, the default end-user credentials are user:123.
